page.title: 11WRAGBY VILLAGE
page.content: Wragby is a pleasant village surrounded by woods and open fields close to Nostell Priory. It is dominated by sandstone houses which provide a warm and friendly environment. The village is very typical of the area and encompasses much of that Yorkshire men hold dear, such as cricket and rugby pitches with the obligatory public house near the centre of Wragby. The chief problem in the village is the main Doncaster road, the A638, which cuts Wragby in half and carries heavy traffic including lorries thoughout the day and night. Most of the village inhabitants find this a nuisance especially the large proportion of elderly people who have lived there all their lives.
